properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 12 at 7:18AM CST until February 12 at 9:30PM CST by NWS Fort Worth TX
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Fort Worth has issued a Flood
Warning for the following areas in Texas...

White Rock Creek Near White Rock Creek At Greenville Ave Affecting
Dallas County

The National Weather Service in Fort Worth has issued a

* Flood Warning for
The White Rock Creek Near White Rock Creek At Greenville Ave.
* until this evening...Or until the warning is cancelled.
* At 0615 AM Wednesday the stage was 82.42 feet.
* Flood stage is 84.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...The river should rise above flood stage by Wednesday
morning due to ongoing moderate rain. It will continue to rise to
a crest near 87 feet by Wednesday morning. The river should fall
below flood stage by late Wednesday morning or early afternoon.
properties.instruction:
Do not drive cars through flooded areas.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Stay tuned to NOAA All Hazards Radio for the latest river forecasts.
